conclusion: Identify relevant angles and distances, use refractive index and angle of view to find critical angle, calculate thickness of tank wall.
Image shows tank with thickness represented by distance AB, light travels from exterior to interior, angle of view is 120°, refractive index is √3, thickness is CD.
Angle of view from interior of tank is 120°.
Angle of incidence on inner surface is θ2 = 60° because it is the complement of 30°, half of 120°.
Using refractive index √3, find critical angle θc for total internal reflection: θc = sin⁻¹(1/√3).
Angle of incidence on outer surface θ1 is difference between critical angle and angle of incidence on inner surface: θ1 = 60° - 30° = 30°.
Thickness of tank wall CD is calculated using tangent of θ1: CD = DE/tan30° = 18/tan30° = 36.
